metadata.Title: CVE-2019-14897 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description: A stack-based buffer overflow was found in the Linux kernel, versionkernel-2.6.32, in Marvell WiFi chip driver. An attacker is able to cause adenial of service (system crash) or, possibly execute arbitrary code, whena STA works in IBSS mode (allows connecting stations together without theuse of an AP) and connects to another STA.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
